alert.note: Alert for La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued December 30 at 7:14AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER. THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER IN MOAB HAS ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH. * TIMING...IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MST THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MST SATURDAY. * AFFECTED AREA...FOR THE LA SAL AND ABAJO MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHEAST UTAH. * AVALANCHE DANGER...DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS EXIST AND DEEP AND DANGEROUS HUMAN TRIGGERED AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY. * IMPACTS...A STRONG STORM SYSTEM ON SUNDAY IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE THE DANGER. HUMAN TRIGGERED AVALANCHES WILL BE CERTAIN AND NATURAL AVALANCHES WILL BE LIKELY. TRAVEL IN AVALANCHE TERRAIN IS NOT RECOMMENDED. STAY OFF OF AND OUT FROM UNDER SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES. BACKCOUNTRY TRAVELERS SHOULD CONSULT WWW.UTAHAVALANCHECENTER.ORG OR CALL 1-888-999-4109 FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.
